sentences.sContent: He dishonored the uniform and did not deserve to be a marine.
sentences.sCn: 他玷污了这身军服，不配当一名海军陆战队士兵。

synos.tran: 拒付；使丢脸；拒绝承兑；不履行（诺言等）

words.tran: 不名誉的；无耻的；不受尊重的（等于dishonorable）

trans.tranCn: 拒付；使丢脸；拒绝承兑；不履行（诺言等）
trans.tranOther: if a bank dishonours a cheque, it refuses to pay out money for it
loss of respect from other people, because you have behaved in a morally unacceptable way
